content.draft_title: Welcome to your new Wagtail site!

content.title: Achievements
content.body:
Achievement Body<h3>üèÜ National Education Award ‚Äì 2024</h3>

<p>Recognized for promoting fairness in rural education.</p>

<h3>üìà 50,000+ Students Impacted</h3>

<p>Reached across 120+ districts through digital initiatives.</p>

<h3>ü§ù Government Collaboration</h3>

<p>Worked with state education departments on policy research.</p>

content.body:
Achievement Body<h3>üèÜ National Education Award ‚Äì 2024</h3>

<p>Recognized for promoting fairness in rural education.</p>

<h3>üìà 50,000+ Students Impacted</h3>

<p>Reached across 120+ districts through digital initiatives.</p>

<h3>ü§ù Government Collaboration</h3>

<p>Worked with state education departments on policy research.</p>

content.title: Achievements
content.achievements:
[{"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "1. WP filed against denial of admission in Preprimary", "description": "WP filed against denial of admission to sibling child, won the case.
    WP filed against collection of capitation fees. By a junior college, refunded with interest approx 8 Crores. 
    PIL filed against purchase compulsion of school essentials like books, uniforms, stationary etc., Won the matter. 
    PTA came in to existence because of FFE PIL in the year 1996. 
    PIL filed in the matter of Catering college malpractices, matter disposed off. 
    PIL filed against International Schools charging huge amount of fees under international name, still pending. 
    PIL filed against conducting interviews for pre primary admissions, still pending. 
    WP filed against non refund of admission fees - fee refunded with 9% interest. 
    PIL filed in the matter of Sarv Shiksha Abhiyan, a scam of 75 Crores was exposed, inquiry ordered, court ordered inquiry against all involved and also cases filed  against all.
     WP filed against Aditya Dental College for harassing girl students and operating without infrastructure. All students got admission in better colleges. 
    WP filed in the matter of denial of admissions to meritorious students, 23 medical students got 20 lacs each as compensation from the SC. Total amount 4.60 crores paid to students.
    PIL filed in against the appointment of Vice Chancellor, appointment of Bombay vice chancellor was cancelled. 
    Refund of almost 20 Crores by different schools due to our intervention. 
    Due to our intervention Scholarships to 119 students from kg till 10 given by A reputed  school Of Santacruz and similarly by Another reputed school of Bandra gave scholarships to  to 35 students. 
    I was the Bansal Committee member appointed by the Govt to fix the norms to decide the fees of private schools. 
    PIL filed in school bus matter. Bus strike prohibited in Maharashtra. Matter decided in our favour. 
    Cases filed in Child Right Commission and got favourable orders in case of  child harassment and expulsion. 
    Many FIR filed in capitation fee matter, management and 12 trustees, all senior citizens with principal were arrested. 
    FIRs filed against many schools collecting Capitation fees. 
    Hunger Strike for Fee Regulation Act. Due to our 8 days hunger strike at Azad Maidan, fee regulation act was formulated in 2011. 
    PIL against 31 schools filed for charging huge fees. 
    Intervention Petition filed in Best Five subjects and percentile system for 11th admissions. 
    WP in the matter of Engineering college admission matter and single CET matter. 
    Hunger Strike for the payment of VI pay commission to the teachers, decided in teachers favour. They got their salaries. 
    PIL  Filed for minimum 75% attendance Compulsory in schools and colleges. Won the matter. 
    PIL  for Limit in number of students. There were more than 170 students in one class room, court restricted it to 80. 
    Quashing of Maharashtra RTI ACT PIL 550/2001.
    PIL to conduct extra classes for weak students in schools. 
    PIL filed to regulate coaching classes in Maharashtra. Govt instructed to regulate but decision not taken by the Govt., yet. 
    Many RTI applications were filed and RTI Seminars were organised to educate parents about RTI. 
    PIL in SC to expedite hearing in HC. 
    PIL in SC to stop astrology subject. Lost it. 
    PIL in HC for Pre primary regulation also moved to SC. Disposed off. 
    PIL against unauthorised 140 schools. 
    Country wide PILs (5)filed in various States High Courts against IME ( institute of mechanical engineers for issuing bogus degree certificates to students, in thousands. We win the case. IME prohibited by HRD ministry too. 
    PIL filed against malpractices in junior college admissions. Got favourable orders and transparency maintained. 
    PIL against engineering colleges for unauthorised permission. 
    PIL against management colleges for admitting 30 extra students illegally. 
    PIL for centralized admissions and online admissions in colleges. 
    PIL against rampant corruption in medical and engineering colleges and misuse of NRI quota. 
    PIL for improving facilities in Govt schools 


WP against 7 colleges for malpractices in admissions 

WP against Central Organization Firm Modernization of Workshop against 10 Crore purchase order 

PIL abolishing management quota in Govt quota 

PIL in Teachers appointment by Govt violating qualification rules

PIL against teachers taking private tuitions, 500 teachers were expelled for taking private tuitions 

Many more achievements of Forum for Fairness in Education 

PIL filed against shifting and closure of school - won it. 

Many protests. Representations, hunger strikes, raasta roko, RTI filed to fight successfully. 

Intervened in one of the school matter, proposed shifting of school from Current  location to different location which was 8 kms away.  School restricted to transfer location as per SC and Govt decision. 

Many issues were solved with amicable talk with managements. FFE supported free genuine schools too and favourable orders were issued by the HC. Favouring schools against parents. 

Many more WP were filed in High Court and Supreme Court.", "image": null}, "id": "d432161f-7ffa-4ab6-a6ec-3493a10d3d00"}]

    PIL for centralized admissions and online admissions in colleges.

    PIL for improving facilities in Govt schools 


WP against 7 colleges for malpractices in admissions 

WP against Central Organization Firm Modernization of Workshop against 10 Crore purchase order 

PIL abolishing management quota in Govt quota 

PIL in Teachers appointment by Govt violating qualification rules

PIL against teachers taking private tuitions, 500 teachers were expelled for taking private tuitions 

Many more achievements of Forum for Fairness in Education 

PIL filed against shifting and closure of school - won it. 

Many protests. Representations, hunger strikes, raasta roko, RTI filed to fight successfully. 

Intervened in one of the school matter, proposed shifting of school from Current  location to different location which was 8 kms away.  School restricted to transfer location as per SC and Govt decision. 

Many issues were solved with amicable talk with managements. FFE supported free genuine schools too and favourable orders were issued by the HC. Favouring schools against parents. 

Many more WP were filed in High Court and Supreme Court.", "image": null}, "id": "d432161f-7ffa-4ab6-a6ec-3493a10d3d00"}]

content.title: Achievements
content.achievements:
[{"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Major Legal & Public Interest Achievements of Forum for Fairness in Education (FFE)", "description": "Protection of Students’ Right to Admission

Successfully filed a Writ Petition against denial of admission to a sibling child, securing admission through court intervention.

Filed a Writ Petition against denial of admission to meritorious students, resulting in ₹4.60 crores compensation (₹20 lakhs each) paid to 23 medical students as ordered by the Supreme Court.

Filed PILs against unauthorised and illegal admissions in junior colleges, engineering colleges, and management institutes, ensuring transparency and compliance.", "image": null}, "id": "d432161f-7ffa-4ab6-a6ec-3493a10d3d00"}]

content.title: Achievements
content.achievements:
[{"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Major Legal & Public Interest Achievements of Forum for Fairness in Education (FFE)", "description": "Protection of Students’ Right to Admission

Successfully filed a Writ Petition against denial of admission to a sibling child, securing admission through court intervention.

Filed a Writ Petition against denial of admission to meritorious students, resulting in ₹4.60 crores compensation (₹20 lakhs each) paid to 23 medical students as ordered by the Supreme Court.

Filed PILs against unauthorised and illegal admissions in junior colleges, engineering colleges, and management institutes, ensuring transparency and compliance.", "image": null}, "id": "d432161f-7ffa-4ab6-a6ec-3493a10d3d00"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Crackdown on Capitation Fees & Illegal Fee Collection", "description": "Filed a Writ Petition against a junior college for collecting capitation fees, resulting in a refund of approximately ₹8 crores with interest.

Intervened in multiple cases leading to refunds of nearly ₹20 crores by various schools.

Filed FIRs against schools collecting capitation fees, leading to the arrest of management members and trustees.

PILs filed against international schools charging exorbitant fees under the guise of international education (matter pending).", "image": null}, "id": "a7f750ab-8209-402c-bb6c-e5ea0526f9d8"}]

content.title: Achievements
content.achievements:
[{"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Major Legal & Public Interest Achievements of Forum for Fairness in Education (FFE)", "description": "Protection of Students’ Right to Admission

Successfully filed a Writ Petition against denial of admission to a sibling child, securing admission through court intervention.

Filed a Writ Petition against denial of admission to meritorious students, resulting in ₹4.60 crores compensation (₹20 lakhs each) paid to 23 medical students as ordered by the Supreme Court.

Filed PILs against unauthorised and illegal admissions in junior colleges, engineering colleges, and management institutes, ensuring transparency and compliance.", "image": null}, "id": "d432161f-7ffa-4ab6-a6ec-3493a10d3d00"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Crackdown on Capitation Fees & Illegal Fee Collection", "description": "Filed a Writ Petition against a junior college for collecting capitation fees, resulting in a refund of approximately ₹8 crores with interest.

Intervened in multiple cases leading to refunds of nearly ₹20 crores by various schools.

Filed FIRs against schools collecting capitation fees, leading to the arrest of management members and trustees.

PILs filed against international schools charging exorbitant fees under the guise of international education (matter pending).", "image": null}, "id": "a7f750ab-8209-402c-bb6c-e5ea0526f9d8"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Fee Regulation & Policy Reforms", "description": "Conducted an 8-day hunger strike at Azad Maidan, which directly led to the formulation of the Maharashtra Fee Regulation Act, 2011.

Filed PILs against 31 schools for charging excessive fees.

Served as a Bansal Committee Member, appointed by the Government, to fix norms for private school fee determination.", "image": null}, "id": "209731d0-eb05-4049-8de1-0402768238fa"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Landmark PILs in Education Governance", "description": "PIL filed against appointment of the Vice Chancellor of Mumbai University, resulting in cancellation of the appointment.

PIL exposed the Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan scam of ₹75 crores, leading to court-ordered inquiry and cases against those involved.

Filed PILs to abolish management quota within government quota.

PILs filed to regulate coaching classes in Maharashtra (government directed to regulate; pending implementation).", "image": null}, "id": "7a47ff01-bd7a-45cb-a600-294ce5ff61bb"}]

content.title: Achievements
content.achievements:
[{"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "

Major Legal & Public Interest Achievements of Forum for Fairness in Education (FFE)

", "description": "

Protection of Students’ Right to Admission • Successfully filed a Writ Petition against denial of admission to a sibling child, securing admission through court intervention. • Filed a Writ Petition against denial of admission to meritorious students, resulting in ₹4.60 crores compensation to 23 medical students. • Filed PILs against unauthorised and illegal admissions in junior colleges, engineering colleges, and management institutes.

", "image": null}, "id": "d432161f-7ffa-4ab6-a6ec-3493a10d3d00"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Crackdown on Capitation Fees & Illegal Fee Collection", "description": "Filed a Writ Petition against a junior college for collecting capitation fees, resulting in a refund of approximately ₹8 crores with interest. Intervened in multiple cases leading to refunds of nearly ₹20 crores by various schools. Filed FIRs against schools collecting capitation fees, leading to the arrest of management members and trustees. PILs filed against international schools charging exorbitant fees under the guise of international education (matter pending).", "image": null}, "id": "a7f750ab-8209-402c-bb6c-e5ea0526f9d8"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Fee Regulation & Policy Reforms", "description": "Conducted an 8-day hunger strike at Azad Maidan, which directly led to the formulation of the Maharashtra Fee Regulation Act, 2011. Filed PILs against 31 schools for charging excessive fees. Served as a Bansal Committee Member, appointed by the Government, to fix norms for private school fee determination.", "image": null}, "id": "209731d0-eb05-4049-8de1-0402768238fa"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Landmark PILs in Education Governance", "description": "PIL filed against appointment of the Vice Chancellor of Mumbai University, resulting in cancellation of the appointment. PIL exposed the Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan scam of ₹75 crores, leading to court-ordered inquiry and cases against those involved. Filed PILs to abolish management quota within government quota. PILs filed to regulate coaching classes in Maharashtra (government directed to regulate; pending implementation).", "image": null}, "id": "7a47ff01-bd7a-45cb-a600-294ce5ff61bb"}]

Filed PILs against 31 schools for charging excessive fees. Served as a Bansal Committee Member, appointed by the Government, to fix norms for private school fee determination.", "image": null}, "id": "209731d0-eb05-4049-8de1-0402768238fa"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Landmark PILs in Education Governance", "description": "PIL filed against appointment of the Vice Chancellor of Mumbai University, resulting in cancellation of the appointment. PIL exposed the Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan scam of ₹75 crores, leading to court-ordered inquiry and cases against those involved. Filed PILs to abolish management quota within government quota. content.title: Achievements
content.achievements:
[{"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Major Legal & Public Interest Achievements of Forum for Fairness in Education (FFE)", "description": "

Protection of Students\u2019 Right to Admission

  • Successfully filed a Writ Petition against denial of admission to a sibling child, securing admission through court intervention.
  • Filed a Writ Petition against denial of admission to meritorious students, resulting in \u20b94.60 crores compensation to 23 medical students.
  • Filed PILs against unauthorised and illegal admissions in junior colleges, engineering colleges, and management institutes.
", "image": null}, "id": "d432161f-7ffa-4ab6-a6ec-3493a10d3d00"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Crackdown on Capitation Fees & Illegal Fee Collection", "description": "

Filed a Writ Petition against a junior college for collecting capitation fees, resulting in a refund of approximately \u20b98 crores with interest. Intervened in multiple cases leading to refunds of nearly \u20b920 crores by various schools. Filed FIRs against schools collecting capitation fees, leading to the arrest of management members and trustees. PILs filed against international schools charging exorbitant fees under the guise of international education (matter pending).

", "image": null}, "id": "a7f750ab-8209-402c-bb6c-e5ea0526f9d8"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Fee Regulation & Policy Reforms", "description": "

Conducted an 8-day hunger strike at Azad Maidan, which directly led to the formulation of the Maharashtra Fee Regulation Act, 2011. Filed PILs against 31 schools for charging excessive fees. Served as a Bansal Committee Member, appointed by the Government, to fix norms for private school fee determination.

", "image": null}, "id": "209731d0-eb05-4049-8de1-0402768238fa"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Landmark PILs in Education Governance", "description": "

PIL filed against appointment of the Vice Chancellor of Mumbai University, resulting in cancellation of the appointment. PIL exposed the Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan scam of \u20b975 crores, leading to court-ordered inquiry and cases against those involved. Filed PILs to abolish management quota within government quota. PILs filed to regulate coaching classes in Maharashtra (government directed to regulate; pending implementation).

", "image": null}, "id": "7a47ff01-bd7a-45cb-a600-294ce5ff61bb"}]

Filed a Writ Petition against a junior college for collecting capitation fees, resulting in a refund of approximately \u20b98 crores with interest. Intervened in multiple cases leading to refunds of nearly \u20b920 crores by various schools. Filed FIRs against schools collecting capitation fees, leading to the arrest of management members and trustees. PILs filed against international schools charging exorbitant fees under the guise of international education (matter pending).

", "image": null}, "id": "a7f750ab-8209-402c-bb6c-e5ea0526f9d8"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Fee Regulation & Policy Reforms", "description": "

Conducted an 8-day hunger strike at Azad Maidan, which directly led to the formulation of the Maharashtra Fee Regulation Act, 2011. Filed PILs against 31 schools for charging excessive fees. Served as a Bansal Committee Member, appointed by the Government, to fix norms for private school fee determination.

", "image": null}, "id": "209731d0-eb05-4049-8de1-0402768238fa"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Landmark PILs in Education Governance", "description": "

PIL filed against appointment of the Vice Chancellor of Mumbai University, resulting in cancellation of the appointment. PIL exposed the Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan scam of \u20b975 crores, leading to court-ordered inquiry and cases against those involved. Filed PILs to abolish management quota within government quota. PILs filed to regulate coaching classes in Maharashtra (government directed to regulate; pending implementation).

", "image": null}, "id": "7a47ff01-bd7a-45cb-a600-294ce5ff61bb"}]

content.title: Achievements
content.achievements:
[{"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Major Legal & Public Interest Achievements of Forum for Fairness in Education (FFE)", "description": "

Protection of Students\u2019 Right to Admission

  • Successfully filed a Writ Petition against denial of admission to a sibling child, securing admission through court intervention.
  • Filed a Writ Petition against denial of admission to meritorious students, resulting in \u20b94.60 crores compensation to 23 medical students.
  • Filed PILs against unauthorised and illegal admissions in junior colleges, engineering colleges, and management institutes.
", "image": null}, "id": "d432161f-7ffa-4ab6-a6ec-3493a10d3d00"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Crackdown on Capitation Fees & Illegal Fee Collection", "description": "
  • Filed a Writ Petition against a junior college for collecting capitation fees, resulting in a refund of approximately \u20b98 crores with interest.
  • Intervened in multiple cases leading to refunds of nearly \u20b920 crores by various schools.
  • Filed FIRs against schools collecting capitation fees, leading to the arrest of management members and trustees.
  • PILs filed against international schools charging exorbitant fees under the guise of international education (matter pending).
", "image": null}, "id": "a7f750ab-8209-402c-bb6c-e5ea0526f9d8"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Fee Regulation & Policy Reforms", "description": "
  • Conducted an 8-day hunger strike at Azad Maidan, which directly led to the formulation of the Maharashtra Fee Regulation Act, 2011.
  • Filed PILs against 31 schools for charging excessive fees.
  • Served as a Bansal Committee Member, appointed by the Government, to fix norms for private school fee determination.
", "image": null}, "id": "209731d0-eb05-4049-8de1-0402768238fa"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Landmark PILs in Education Governance", "description": "
  • PIL filed against appointment of the Vice Chancellor of Mumbai University, resulting in cancellation of the appointment.
  • PIL exposed the Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan scam of \u20b975 crores, leading to court-ordered inquiry and cases against those involved.
  • Filed PILs to abolish management quota within government quota.
  • PILs filed to regulate coaching classes in Maharashtra (government directed to regulate; pending implementation).
", "image": null}, "id": "7a47ff01-bd7a-45cb-a600-294ce5ff61bb"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Safeguarding Children\u2019s Rights & Welfare", "description": "
  • Cases filed before the Child Rights Commission resulted in favourable orders against harassment and unlawful expulsion of students.
  • Filed PIL against conducting interviews for pre-primary admissions (pending).
  • Filed PIL for mandatory minimum 75% attendance, which was allowed by the court.
  • Filed PIL limiting overcrowding in classrooms, reducing class size from 170+ students to a maximum of 80.
", "image": null}, "id": "d31bdf1a-3ca2-4b89-aa40-1317e6138f39"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Institutional Accountability & Malpractice Exposure", "description": "
  • Filed PILs against unauthorised schools (140 institutions) operating illegally.
  • Filed nationwide PILs against Institute of Mechanical Engineers (IME) for issuing bogus degree certificates to thousands of students.
    Result: IME was prohibited by the HRD Ministry.
  • PILs against medical and engineering colleges for misuse of NRI quota and corruption.
  • PIL against catering colleges for malpractices (disposed of).
", "image": null}, "id": "6690dd46-e015-448e-b853-520ddcccf4b1"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Scholarships & Financial Relief for Students", "description": "
  • Secured scholarships for 119 students (KG to Class 10) from a reputed Santacruz school.
  • Secured scholarships for 35 students from a reputed Bandra school.
  • Filed WP for non-refund of admission fees, resulting in refund with 9% interest.
", "image": null}, "id": "853ee1c0-4bf4-4677-b50b-2df0189c5c10"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Teachers\u2019 Rights & Educational Standards", "description": "
  • Led a hunger strike for implementation of the 6th Pay Commission, resulting in teachers receiving pending salaries.
  • PIL filed against unqualified teacher appointments by the Government.
  • PIL against teachers taking private tuitions, leading to expulsion of over 500 teachers.
  • PIL to improve infrastructure and facilities in government schools.
", "image": null}, "id": "832fe508-7486-4cf4-aaa7-a846aced4640"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Transport, Safety & Infrastructure", "description": "
  • Filed PIL in the school bus strike matter, resulting in a statewide prohibition of bus strikes in Maharashtra.
  • Filed PIL against forced purchase of school essentials such as uniforms, books, and stationery \u2014 won the case.
  • Filed PIL against shifting and closure of schools, successfully preventing unjustified relocations.
", "image": null}, "id": "773a7aa8-8195-4cb4-be5e-6ecd53af82f4"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Admissions Transparency & Reforms", "description": "
  • Intervention petition filed regarding Best Five subjects and percentile system for Class 11 admissions.
  • WP in engineering admissions advocating for single CET system.
  • PILs for centralised and online admissions across colleges.
  • PIL against colleges admitting 30 extra students illegally.
", "image": null}, "id": "c6e8f6ee-e0d2-4d0d-9914-7a6fad04a99a"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "RTI Advocacy & Awareness", "description": "
  • Filed numerous RTI applications to expose corruption.
  • Conducted RTI seminars to educate parents and stakeholders on their rights.
  • PIL filed against quashing of Maharashtra RTI Act (PIL 550/2001).
", "image": null}, "id": "1778cb68-efe4-4c3b-a291-c1ef659e6934"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Public Movements & Grassroots Action", "description": "
  • Organised hunger strikes, protests, rasta roko movements, and formal representations to authorities.
  • Successfully resolved many disputes amicably through dialogue with school managements.
  • Supported genuine schools in litigation where parents\u2019 claims were unfounded, securing favourable High Court orders.
", "image": null}, "id": "dec3f31c-f251-472a-b041-9e899eebf954"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Ongoing & Continuing Efforts", "description": "
  • PILs in Supreme Court to expedite High Court hearings.
  • PIL to stop astrology as an academic subject (dismissed).
  • PIL for pre-primary regulation (disposed of).
  • PIL against international schools\u2019 fee practices (pending).
", "image": null}, "id": "c437fe36-5421-4c39-81a9-7f30a189d1ec"}, {"type": "achievement", "value": {"title": "Legacy", "description": "

Forum for Fairness in Education (FFE) has consistently fought for transparency, fairness, accountability, and justice in the education system through hundreds of legal interventions, policy reforms, and public movements \u2014 many of which have shaped Maharashtra\u2019s education landscape.

", "image": null}, "id": "fb6d992f-f28d-47ef-bcbe-5225a2c586cb"}]
